reviewText: This novela was an absolute HIT in my country. As with HIT novelas, the TV station that was screening it had to repeat the last two episodes due to public demand. Needless to say, I am glad to have those memories in my house!!The DVD is abridged. I have to write this for the sake of those who buy the DVD without reading the customer reviews or the Product details. This means that you will only get the bullet points from the novela. None of that Plot B and Plot C characters who are only there to fill up the 45 minutes of an episode.Despite being abridged, the DVD is great. It was great to see that scene where Valentina finally smiles at Jose Miguel, when she takes him Hacienda Montesinos (after she had shot him by mistake). Priceless, I tell you!!!I also loved the bloopers, and it seems that Lucero is a natural comedian. She doesn't seem stuck up as she makes funny faces, or screws up the lines, or dances around the set. That was something I enjoyed watching.Unfortunately, they left out some important scenes, e.g. When Valentina goes to serenade Jose Miguel at Hacienda Montesinos, when Valentina, Gaby, Horatio and Jose Miguel double date at the county fair, and when she sings again in the church during their wedding!! What a travesty that they left out such important scenes!! How Now!! I am fine with them leaving out the "swimming in the perfect blue waters at the river scenes" but this was just wrong.When the show was screened in my country, it was in the English dub. As I recall, Illuminada had an awesome voice over, especially when she's say "Jeepers Creepers!!" I really miss that!! I also miss how Rosendo's character would refer to Jose miguel as "That Stuck Up Dandy!!" Memories!!However, as I have mentioned in my review of Manana es Para Siempre DVD and other Novelas I have bought, Televisa needs to consider releasing novelas in their entirety, add other languages to the subtitles in addition to English(also for the sake of those who are deaf), and not restrict the DVD to Region 1. America is not the only market for these DVD's.[UPDATE] I have seen that Televisa is re-releasing the DVD version of Amor Real in 2 volumes of 750 minutes each, I hope this is the trend for all future releases of these novelas, so that we can get a fleshier story.

reviewText: Soy tu dueña (I Am Your Mistress - 830 minutes) Classic telenovela: thwarted romance, evil scheming mother and cousin, Who's Your Daddy?, and our heroine Valentina, played by Lucero, is often in jeopardy (snakes, poison, kidnapping, unruly horse) and is jilted (almost) twice.At least our dauntless hero José Miguel Montesinos, portrayed by Fernando Colunga, is an adult and is understandably skeptical of his mother Leonor's schemes along with those of Valentina's greedy cousin, Ivana, played by Gabriela Spanic.Our heroine is a lovely, successful business woman who just can't seem to catch a break. Her first fiancé Alonso, played by David Zapeda, jilts her at the altar and she flees to her property in the country where she becomes the unbending mistress of the plantation: tough, mean and focused on business. Her neighbor is José Miguel, whose mother Leonor, played by Jacqueline Andere, has been hiding his real paternity all his life.The producers for this series found extremely classy horses for the plantations and the villain Rosendo Gavilán is played by our favorite mustachioed bad guy, Sergio Goyri, but I thought they'd NEVER get to that final wedding scene! These telenovelas from Amazon are a hoot and I LOVE them!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I saw the orignial version of this story called "LA DUENA" starring Angelica Rivera and Francisco Gattorno. "SOY TU DUENA" (I'm Your Owner) while the two main actors, Lucero (a popular Mexican singer and actress) and Fernando Colunga (the Mexican version of Mel Gibson) did a fantastic job, it is nothing more than a remake. I saw the very first episode to the last during the course of 6 months, and almost every scene and dailouge was EXACTLY the same as "LA DUENA." I'm very famimliar with the orignial so I'm not exagerating. The only MAJOR difference between the two novelas is the final episode (gran final) when the two main characters are about to get married and the villin in the 2010 version comes back armed with a pistol when he was supposed to be dead. During the orignal, the wedding was even greater because there was not 1 but 4 weddings at the same time! Another difference is the names of each character is changed: The owner in the original is called Regina Vidareal, in the new version is Valentina. The town for which she is owner of is called Los Cascabeles is both versions.STORY PLOT: A beautiful, young and generous woman is left standing alone at the altar on the day of her wedding, betrayed by her fiance and unknown to her, her own cousin (Laura in the oringinal becomes Ivana in the new,) who is like a sister to her. Regina (or Valentina) was orphaned when her parents both died in a terrible car accident when she was a child. Her aunt, the mother of Laura (or Ivana) raised her. After suffering a major breakdown, pain turns to bitterness and forces Regina (Valentina) to leave for the town she once swore never to return to, Los Cascabeles, of which she inherited from her parents and she is now the owner of. It is not until the arrival of a handsome young man in a neighboring town that Regina's (Valentina's) life is forever changed. In him she will find compassion, understanding, friendship and above all...love. And that is exactly what she fears the most, to fall in love and be hurt again. But the man in charge of Los Cascabeles (Macario, or Rosendo) is obessed with the beautiful young owner of the town, and will not allow any man to get near her. Laura (Ivana) the cousin meanwhile always jealous of what Regina (Valentina) has will stop at nothing to take everything Regina holds most dear...including her new found love. Can the passion and love of one man soften the heart of the owner of the town (la duena?)NOTE: LA DUENA has English subtitles, but the only set back is that it has been edited and chopped down so much, it has been reduced to 6 hours. But it still is a great dvd giving only the most important scenes enough to explain the story and main characters. SOY TU DUENA is much longer on dvd and gives more of the story in general, but I don't know if it has English subtitiles.
summary: Remake of the classic 1995 "LA DUENA" (The Owner)

reviewText: Ordene esta Exelente Telenovela en Dvd en Amazon.comEstoy Ansioso por volver a verla y tenerla en mis manos, para Coleccionarla y poder Disfrutarla Nuevamente.Soy tu Dueña Fue y Es una de las Mejores Telenovelas del 2010/2011, tiene un Gran Elenco y una Exelente Adaptacion, ademas de contar con las Magnificas Actuaciones de Lucero, Fernando Colunga, Gaby Spanic, David Zepeda, Sergio Goyri, Jacqueline Andere, Ana Martin, Silvia Pinal, Eduardo Capetillo, Marisol del Olmo, Fabian Robles, Fatima Torre, Ana Bertha Espin, Jose Carlos Ruiz, Julio Aleman, Eric del Castillo, Tony Bravo, entre otros...Soy Fan de Lucero, Fernando Colunga y de Gabriela Spanic, y (Para Mi) el Personaje de Ivana Dorantes Es Sublime, fue Exelente, Unico, Gaby Spanic hizo un Magnifico Trabajo e Interpreto una de las Mejores Villanas de la Historia de las Telenovelas Mexicanas, Me Encanto, al igual que Jacqueline Andere, es una Exelente Actriz y se lucio muchisimo el el Papel de Leonor. Son Muy Buenas Antagonistas y la verdad me gusto muchismo sus Actuaciones.Muero por tenerla Ya!!! Me Encanto la Portada, se ve Realmente Hermosa. Esta Muy Bonita la Presentacion del Dvd. Espero que la Edicion y los Resumenes esten bien hechos, que contenga Lo Mejor de la Telenovela.Solo me resta Esperar a que me llegue y comenzar a verla.Cuando tenga el Dvd y lo vea les cuento que tal esta...27/5/2011: Me Gusto Mucho el Dvd, Contiene un Buen Resumen, solo que considero que Quitaron Mucho de los Ultimos Capitulos, por ejemplo Escenas Importantes, como: lo que pasa despues de la Muerte de Benita, si bien las Escenas en que Ivana la mata estan completas falta todo lo que pasa despues, cuando Iluminada la encuentra tirada, cuando le dice a Sabino, cuando Valentina se entera, todo el velorio, que si bien no me gustan las escenas de los velorios, habian partes de Ivana que estaban muy buenas, como por ejemplo cuando discutia con el ataul de Benita, entre otras...El Dvd 3 termina en la Muerte de Benita y el 4 empieza ya en el entierro, se pierde todo eso...Despues falta cuando Valentina va a la Casa de los Montesinos a buscar a Jose Miguel y se enfrenta con Leonor e Ivana le dice a Valentina que Leonor fue Amante de Rosendo, luego las Escenas donde Valentina le agradece a Ivana por defenderla de Leonor y en ese momento se genera una Pelea entre ambas por Jose Miguel e Ivana le siembra la duda de que ella no sabe si lo hace por ella o por interes.Me hubiera gustado mucho que dejaran los dialogos de Leonor con Rosendo, luego de haberle confesado a Jose Miguel que Rosendo es su Padre. Realmente eran Escenas Muy Fuertes y que me gustaron mucho de Jacqueline Andere. Solo dejan hasta que Jose Miguel se entera de la verdad.Faltan todas las Escenas de las ultimas Alucinaciones de Ivana, la que se le aparece Oscar cuando esta por hacer el amor con Rosendo, la Alucinacion que tiene frente a  Valentina e incluso en las que se le aparece Benita, me da pena, porque eran escenas muy buenas.Casi sobre el Final quitaron todo el proceso de cuando Isabel encierra a Ivana en la recamara para que no haga mas nada e Ivana intenta Matar a su Madre con una tijera, luego ella finge sentirse mal para que Iluminada la deje salir, la golpea y se escapa, y al intentar huir de la Ascienda escucha que el Comandante Toledo le dice a Valentina que tiene lista la orden de aprehension en su contra o que de lo contario sera trasladada a un Hospital Psiquiatrico. Ya sobre su Final, en las Escenas donde se esta por Suicidar falta la parte en que ella se toca el cuello y se dice a si misma si cree que su cuello se vera feo o se maltratara mucho y cuando se ahorca no se ve su cara y los ojos como se vio en Television.En el Final no estan las Escenas en que Leonor le agradece a Sabino su Lealtad y le pide que siga al lado de Jose Miguel y de ella porque lo necesitan mucho, tampoco se ve cuando Leonor se reconcilia con Jose Miguel. Sacaron la Escena en que Felipe va a Los Cascabeles y le dice a todos que tiene el resultado de la autopsia y que Ivana nunca estubo embarazada.No se ve la Conversacion de Alonso con Gaby ni cuando Valentina y Jose Miguel le hablan a Federico en su tumba y le dicen que van a cumplir su promesa de unir las 2 Asciendas y llamarla El Milagro.Quitaron el Final de Zamarripa, el complice de Rosendo, no se ve cuando lo axfisia, tampoco esta el Brindis despues del Bautizmo de los Hijos de Valentina y Jose Miguel.Pese a eso, lo demas Esta Bien Editado, tiene coherencia, se entiende y no se notan cortes bruscos, solo que para los que ya vimos Soy Tu Dueña en Television hecharemos de menos muchas Escenas que nos gustaron mucho y consideramos importantes, que en el Dvd no estan.El Dvd Contiene un Resumen de 830 Minutos Aproximadamente, 13 Horas y 50, con Lo Mejor de la Telenovela y un Material Extra con Escenas Candentes y Bloopers de casi 22 Minutos.En Total el Dvd Dura 851 Minutos, 14 Horas y 11 Minutos.Yo Sume los 4 Discos, uno a uno y me dio ese tiempo de Duracion.
summary: Comentario sobre la Edicion en Dvd de Soy tu Dueña

reviewText: It's basically the hottest thing I've ever seen. And it's not just sexy, it's well put together. My one quibble is that they altered the placement in the story of one of the sex scenes that just doesn't make sense. Like, literally, it doesn't make sense, but you'll get over it. The extras include twenty minutes of uncensored sex scenes. Random. But how can you complain?
